Overview.Summary: The Scottish local elections of 2017 were a hot topic, and specifically, the focus was on the Scottish Conservatives party (Crawl Date: 4/June/2017, Crawl Date: 22/March/2017, Crawl Date: 28/June/2017, Crawl Date: 30/June/2017, Crawl Date: 29/June/2017, Crawl Date: 23/April/2017, Crawl Date: 28/June/2017, Crawl Date: 22/June/2017, Crawl Date: 13/June/2017, Crawl Date: 1/July/2017). The Conservative manifesto, published in May 2017, was referenced (Crawl Date: 28/June/2017), and there was discussion surrounding potential independence referendums (Crawl Date: 22/March/2017, Crawl Date: 1/July/2017). The possibility of the Conservatives winning more seats was also mentioned (Crawl Date: 23/April/2017). There was a strong support for the Conservatives in comparison to other parties (Crawl Date: 22/June/2017, Crawl Date: 28/June/2017), and there was also debate surrounding EU citizens in the UK (Crawl Date: 28/June/2017). There were contrasting opinions about the outcome of the election and potential promises made by the different parties (Crawl Date: 29/June/2017, Crawl Date: 13/June/2017). Overall, the focus of the articles was on the Scottish Conservatives party and their involvement in the 2017 Scottish local elections.

Timeline.Text: Scotland's First Minister Nicola Sturgeon announces her intention to call for a second Scottish independence referendum.
The British Conservative Party targets 12 Scottish seats in the upcoming General Election.
The Conservatives have only one Scottish seat after the UK General Election.
Scottish voters express their desire for the replacement of a net migration target, according to a poll.
The Scottish Fiscal and Economic Studies is dedicated to exploring economic and fiscal topics related to Scotland's constitutional change.

Overview.Summary: The 2017 Scottish local elections were widely covered by various news sources (1-10) due to its significance. Conservative Party leader Ruth Davidson made headlines with her campaigning efforts and was favored by some as a leader of the opposition (1). On election day, the Scottish Conservatives gained a record number of seats under Davidson's leadership (8). Despite this, there were doubts raised about the Tory deal with the DUP and the potential for it to damage the union (7). A record number of LGBTQ candidates ran in the election, including Davidson who is openly lesbian (9). According to a Lord Ashcroft Poll, Davidson was ranked third among Tory hopefuls after Theresa May and Boris Johnson (10). Jeremy Corbyn and Gillian Anderson also played a role in the lead up to the elections, with Corbyn giving a speech on Europe (3) and Anderson appearing in a tweet posted by Davidson (4,5).

Timeline.Text: The Times reports on the upcoming Scottish local elections, showing a rise in popularity for Ruth Davidson as a potential opposition leader.
Ruth Davidson secures a record number of seats for the Scottish Conservative party in the local elections, sending a strong message to the SNP about preserving the Union.
Jeremy Corbyn and Ruth Davidson are among the top candidates for preferred party leader amongst LGBTQ voters.
The elections result in a record number of LGBTQ members in Parliament, including Ruth Davidson.
Lord Ashcroft Polls releases data on the preferences of voters for party leaders, with Ruth Davidson coming in third.
Ruth Davidson is included in a list of people associated with Jeremy Corbyn in a series of news articles.
Ruth Davidson ruffles feathers by posting a picture on Twitter with Gillian Anderson.
An article from UK Polling Report highlights the opinions of voters about the Conservative and Scottish National parties, with a focus on Ruth Davidson and Kezia Dugdale.
The Guardian publishes an article discussing the potential impact of a DUP and Tory alliance on the Union and Thatcherite policies, referencing Ruth Davidson.

Overview.Summary: Scottish First Minister Nicola Sturgeon is a prominent figure in the 2017 Scottish local elections (1,2,3). She has called for a new independence referendum and is focusing on sovereignty and EU membership (4,5,6). This move has been met with controversy and division within Scotland (7,8). Sturgeon's leadership and policies have also been praised and criticized by other political leaders (9). One of the potential outcomes of these elections is the possibility of Scottish independence (10).

Timeline.Text: Nicola Sturgeon's call for another Scottish independence referendum sparks political debate and controversy.
Nicola Sturgeon addresses a conference of the Scottish National Party and discusses the possibility of another Scottish independence referendum.
Scottish lawmakers begin debating Nicola Sturgeon's call for a new independence referendum.
The New York Times reports on the impact of Brexit and Nicola Sturgeon's political career.
Experts discuss the possibility of Scottish independence and the role of Nicola Sturgeon in the Brexit negotiations.
The Scottish local elections take place and Nicola Sturgeon hails them as a great success for the Scottish National Party.
EU citizens' rights and the upcoming local elections are important issues in the political campaign.
Nicola Sturgeon appears on television and discusses her political stance.
The results of the local elections and the stance on Brexit are major topics of discussion for Nicola Sturgeon.
Nicola Sturgeon announces she is postponing plans for another Scottish independence referendum.

Overview.Summary: The Scottish local elections in 2017 saw a significant impact from the Scottish National Party (SNP) (2,4,9,10). The UK Labour Party faced a tough competition from SNP in the Scottish seats, resulting in a loss of almost all seats (2). The elections also sparked debates and discussions on devolution, electoral results, and national parliaments (3,6,9). Criticisms of representative democracy and calls for democratic innovations were also highlighted (7). The performance of SNP in the elections raised questions about the political landscape in Scotland and its impact on the UK (5).

Timeline.Text: The Scottish National Party (SNP) announces its candidates for the upcoming local elections.
The SNP performs well in the local elections.
The Scottish Conservatives close the gap with the Democratic Unionist Party (DUP) in the local elections.
The Scottish Labour party is virtually wiped out in the local elections.

Overview.Summary: The 2017 Scottish local elections took place on May 29, 2017 and involved 18 counties, 56 cities and 103 municipalities (1). The results of the election have been attributed to the country's mindset in regards to Brexit and Trump, as well as other issues such as local school initiatives and strategic planning (3). The session was considered a groundbreaking and political challenge to local democracy as usual (7). Local elections in the UK were held on May 4, 2017 (6). The Conservative manifesto, published in 2017, discusses issues related to Brexit and other economic concerns (9).

Timeline.Text: The 2017 Scottish local elections take place, with voting in various counties, cities, and municipalities.
Patrick Chalmers publishes a piece detailing his opinions on representative democracy and its problems.
Methodology for recording local council data is updated.
A trailer for the 2017 adaptation of Stephen King's novel It is released.

Overview.Summary: The 2017 Scottish local elections (1,2) resulted in changes in local councils in Scotland, with some elections not taking place at the same time in all areas (1). DARE Network, which stands for Democracy and Human Rights Education in Europe, was established as a result of these elections (3). The Scottish government published the Conservative manifesto and discussed issues related to constitutional change in Scotland (6). The 2017 Crofting Elections (10) will result in 6 people being elected to the management industry, large companies, local authorities, property industry, or regulators.

Timeline.Text: The Scottish local election results are announced, with the Conservative party gaining seats.
The Conservative manifesto for the Scottish local elections is published.
The leader of the Labour party rejects calls for a second Scottish independence referendum.
The first round of Scottish crofting elections takes place, with 6 people being elected.

Overview.Summary: No articles focused solely on the aspect of the 2017 Scottish local elections. However, the articles do mention various aspects of the elections, such as the annual meeting of qualified proprietors and elections in October 2017 (2), the rejection of a second Scottish independence referendum (5), and the upcoming March 2017 crofting elections (6). The articles also discuss the results of the 2017 general election and their impact on the Scottish political landscape (3,4,9).

Timeline.Text: The Scottish Parliamentary Elections (Returning Officers) Regulations are amended.
The local elections in Orkney, Shetland, and the Western Isles are covered.
The first 2017 crofting elections take place, with the next ones scheduled for March 2017.
New boundaries for 2018 are announced.

Overview.Summary: The 2017 Scottish local elections were held on May 4, 2017 (1, 3, 5, 19,20). The Scottish National Party (SNP) was seeking readmission to the European Union and for Scotland to have its own independence (17, 16, 6, 12). The Scottish Conservatives made significant gains in the election (4), narrowing the gap with the governing Democratic Unionist Party in Northern Ireland (20). The Scottish Labour Party also saw a decrease in seats (18), while UKIP did not run candidates in Scotland (15).

Nicky Morgan leads other leaders to weigh in on the future of the United Kingdom without Scotland.
Nicky Morgan assesses the progress that has been made since Great Britain's 2015 general election.
